intro: Glaux atacamensis, commonly known as the Atacama glaucous, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting to its harsh environment. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are often concealed among its foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and is highly resilient to extreme temperatures and low precipitation. Due to its unique adaptations, it is considered an important species in the study of desert flora.
